definition: to grant/to give/to bestow/to act/to carry out
to say/to tell/to announce/to report/to denounce/to file a lawsuit/to sue

sentences.english: Journalists are studying the minister's speech for pointers to the contents of next month's policy statement.
sentences.chinese: 記者們在研究部長講話以揣摩下月施政報告中的動向。

sentences.english: It thus seems that people are rather positive about this year's address.
sentences.chinese: 由此看來，巿民似乎對施政報告有不錯的評價。

sentences.english: Members from the drafting group introduce the mock policy address during a press conference.
sentences.chinese: 起草小組成員於新聞發佈會上介紹模擬施政報告。

sentences.english: Mr Tung will disclose more details in his policy address.
sentences.chinese: 董建華將在施政報告中透露更多詳情。

sentences.english: People from all walks of life, including government officials highly appreciate the mock policy address.
sentences.chinese: 模擬施政報告得到社會各界及政府部門的高度肯定。

definition: Carrie Lam (1957-), chief executive of Hong Kong 2017-, full name 林鄭月娥|林郑月娥[Lin2 Zheng4 Yue4 e2] Carrie Lam Cheng Yuet-ngor
special administrative region/abbr. for 特別行政區|特别行政区
to take part in an election/to run for office
to set/to designate/to stipulate/to provide/to draw up/to formulate (rules etc)/stipulation
